thread.title: HTC claims Apple copies its devices despite the One A9's iPhone 6S-inspired design - Tech
thread.title_full: HTC claims Apple copies its devices despite the One A9's iPhone 6S-inspired design - Tech News - Digital Spy

author: Luke Johnson
title: HTC claims Apple copies its devices despite the One A9's iPhone 6S-inspired design - Tech
text: Despite the newly-unveiled HTC One A9 looking like a near carbon copy of the iPhone 6S, HTC has claimed that it is in fact Apple that has copied its designs.With the Taiwanese manufacturer seemingly struggling with the linear concept of time, and the order in which the two products dropped, the company has flatly refuted claims that the A9 is an iPhone rip. © Digital Spy Samsung Galaxy S7: Everything you need to knowHighlighting its past handset designs, including the likes of the HTC One M8 and follow-on One M9, HTC has suggested it has been working towards the A9's finish for some time and Apple jumped to metal phones with distinct antenna lines after it did."We're not copying," HTC's President of North Asia, Jack Tong, told the China Times, via TrustedReviews. "We made a uni-body, metal-clad phone in 2013." © Digital Spy Shifting the blame, he added: "It's Apple that copies us in terms of the antenna design on the back."The A9 is made thinner and more lightweight than our previous metal-clad phones. This is a change and evolution, and we're not copying."Familiar form factor aside, the HTC One A9 is hoping to bring a bit of style to the mid-market smartphone space.Despite a £469.99 asking price, the phone's 5-inch, 1080p Full HD display, Snapdragon 617 processor, 2GB of RAM and 13-megapixel camera are a somewhat middling array of innards.
